rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عِوَجَا ۜ
rows.translation: All praise belongs to Allah, who has sent down the Book to His servant and did not let any crookedness be in it,
rows.transliteration: al-ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī anzala `alā `abdihil kitāba walam yaj`al lahu `iwajā ۜ

rows.arabic: قَيِّمًا لِّيُنذِرَ بَأْسًا شَدِيدًا مِّن لَّدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا
rows.translation: [a Book] upright, to warn of a severe punishment from Him, and to give good news to the faithful who do righteous deeds, that there shall be for them a good reward,
rows.transliteration: qayyimal liyundhira ba-san shadīdan min ladunhu wayubashhiral mu-minīnal ladhīna ya`malūnaṣ ṣāliḥāti anna lahum ajran ḥasanā

rows.arabic: مَّـٰكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًا
rows.translation: to abide in it forever,
rows.transliteration: mākithīna fīhi abadā

rows.arabic: وَيُنذِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًا
rows.translation: and to warn those who say, ‘Allah has taken a son.’
rows.transliteration: wayundhiral ladhīna qālut-takhadhallāhu waladā

rows.arabic: مَّا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ وَلَا لِـَٔابَآئِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ ۚ إِن يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًا
rows.translation: They do not have any knowledge of that, nor did their fathers. Monstrous is the utterance that comes out of their mouths, and they say nothing but a lie.
rows.transliteration: mā lahum bihi min `il-min walā li-ābā-ihim ۚ kaburat kalimatan takhruju min afwāhihim ۚ in yaqūlūna illā kadhibā

rows.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِمْ إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا
rows.translation: You are liable to imperil your life out of grief for their sake, if they should not believe this discourse.
rows.transliteration: fala`allaka bākhi`un nafsaka `alā āthārihim in lam yu-minū bihādhal ḥadīthi asafā

rows.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ زِينَةً لَّهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا
rows.translation: Indeed We have made whatever is on the earth an adornment for it that We may test them [to see] which of them is best in conduct.
rows.transliteration: innā ja`alnā mā `alal-arḍi zīnatan lahā linabluwahum ayyuhum aḥsanu `amalā

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَـٰعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًا جُرُزًا
rows.translation: And indeed We will turn whatever is on it into a barren plain.
rows.transliteration: wa innā lajā`ilūna mā `alayhā ṣa`īdan juruzā

rows.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْكَهْفِ وَٱلرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا۟ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا عَجَبًا
rows.translation: Do you suppose that the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription were among Our wonderful signs?
rows.transliteration: am ḥasibta anna aṣ-ḥābal kahfi war raqīmi kānū min āyātinā `ajabā

rows.arabic: إِذْ أَوَى ٱلْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
rows.translation: When the youths took refuge in the Cave, they said, ‘Our Lord! Grant us a mercy from Yourself, and help us on to rectitude in our affair.’
rows.transliteration: idh awal fityatu ilal-kahfi faqālū rabbanā ātinā min ladunka raḥmatan wahayyi-lanā min amrinā rashadā

rows.arabic: فَضَرَبْنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ فِى ٱلْكَهْفِ سِنِينَ عَدَدًا
rows.translation: So We put them to sleep in the Cave for several years.
rows.transliteration: faḍarabnā `alā ādhānihim fil kahfi sinīna `adadā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِنَعْلَمَ أَىُّ ٱلْحِزْبَيْنِ أَحْصَىٰ لِمَا لَبِثُوٓا۟ أَمَدًا
rows.translation: Then We aroused them that We might know which of the two groups better reckoned the period they had stayed.
rows.transliteration: thumma ba`athnāhum lina`lama ayyul ḥizbayni aḥṣā limā labithū amadā

rows.arabic: نَّحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَـٰهُمْ هُدًى
rows.translation: We relate to you their account in truth. They were indeed youths who had faith in their Lord, and We had enhanced them in guidance,
rows.transliteration: naḥnu naquṣṣu `alayka naba-ahum bil ḥaqq ۚ innahum fityatun āmanū birabbihim wazidnāhum hudā

rows.arabic: وَرَبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ إِذْ قَامُوا۟ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَن نَّدْعُوَا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَـٰهًا ۖ لَّقَدْ قُلْنَآ إِذًا شَطَطًا
rows.translation: and fortified their hearts, when they stood up and said, ‘Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never invoke any god besides Him, for then we shall certainly have said an atrocious lie.
rows.transliteration: warabaṭnā `alā qulūbihim idh qāmū faqālū rabbunā rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi lan nad`uwa min dūnihi ilāhā ۖ laqad qulnā idhan shaṭaṭā

rows.arabic: هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمُنَا ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةً ۖ لَّوْلَا يَأْتُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۭ بَيِّنٍ ۖ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
rows.translation: These—our people—have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not bring any clear authority touching them? So who is a greater wrongdoer than he who fabricates a lie against Allah?
rows.transliteration: hā-ulā-i qawmunat-takhadhū min dūnihi ālihah ۖ lawlā ya-tūna `alayhim bisulṭānin bayyin ۖ faman aẓlamu mimmanif-tarā `alallāhi kadhibā

rows.arabic: وَإِذِ ٱعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ فَأْوُۥٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ يَنشُرْ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَيُهَيِّئْ لَكُم مِّنْ أَمْرِكُم مِّرْفَقًا
rows.translation: When you have dissociated yourselves from them and from what they worship except Allah, then take refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will unfold His mercy for you, and He will help you on to ease in your affair.’
rows.transliteration: wa idhi'-tazaltumūhum wa mā ya`budūna illallāha fa-uwū ilal-kahfi yanshur lakum rabbukum min raḥmatihi wayuhayyi-lakum min amrikum mirfaqā

rows.arabic: وَتَرَى ٱلشَّمْسَ إِذَا طَلَعَت تَّزَٰوَرُ عَن كَهْفِهِمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَإِذَا غَرَبَت تَّقْرِضُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ وَهُمْ فِى فَجْوَةٍ مِّنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ مَن يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ فَهُوَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُۥ وَلِيًّا مُّرْشِدًا
rows.translation: You may see the sun, when it rises, slanting toward the right of their cave, and, when it sets, cut across them towards the left, and they are in a cavern within it. That is one of Allah’s signs. Whomever Allah guides is rightly guided, and whomever He leads astray, you will never find for him any guardian or guide.
rows.transliteration: watarash shamsa idhā ṭala`at tazāwaru `an kahfihim dhātal yamīni wa idhā gharabat taqriḍuhum dhātash shimāli wahum fī fajwatim minh ۚ dhālika min āyātillāh ۗ man yahdillāhu fahuwal muhtad ۖ wa man yuḍlil falan tajida lahu waliyyan murshidā

rows.arabic: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌ ۚ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ ۖ وَكَلْبُهُم بَـٰسِطٌ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِٱلْوَصِيدِ ۚ لَوِ ٱطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًا
rows.translation: You will suppose them to be awake, although they are asleep. We turn them to the right and to the left, and their dog [lies] stretching its forelegs at the threshold. If you come upon them, you will surely turn to flee from them, and you will surely be filled with a terror of them.
rows.transliteration: wataḥsabuhum ayqāẓan wahum ruqūd ۚ wanuqallibuhum dhātal yamīni wadhātash shimāl ۖ wakalbuhum bāsiṭun dhirā`ayhi bil waṣīd ۚ lawiṭ-ṭala`ta `alayhim lawallayta minhum firāran walamuli-ta minhum ru`bā

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِيَتَسَآءَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ ۚ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ فَٱبْعَثُوٓا۟ أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنظُرْ أَيُّهَآ أَزْكَىٰ طَعَامًا فَلْيَأْتِكُم بِرِزْقٍ مِّنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: So it was that We aroused them [from sleep] so that they might question one another. One of them said, ‘How long have you stayed [here]?’ They said, ‘We have stayed a day, or part of a day.’ They said, ‘Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed. Send one of you to the city with this money. Let him observe which of them has the purest food, and bring you provisions from there. Let him be attentive, and let him not make anyone aware of you.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika ba`athnāhum liyatasā-alū baynahum ۚ qāla qā-ilun minhum kam labithtum ۖ qālū labithnā yawman aw ba`ḍa yawm ۚ qālū rabbukum a`lamu bimā labithtum fab`athū aḥadakum biwariqikum hādhihi ilal-madīnati falyanẓur ayyuhā azkā ṭa`āman falya-tikum birizqin minhu walyatalaṭṭaf walā yush`iranna bikum aḥadā

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِى مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًا
rows.translation: Indeed should they prevail over you, they will [either] stone you [to death], or force you back into their creed, and then you will never be saved. ’
rows.transliteration: innahum in yaẓharū `alaykum yarjumūkum aw yu`īdūkum fī millatihim walan tufliḥū idhan abadā

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَآ إِذْ يَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَمْرَهُمْ ۖ فَقَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَـٰنًا ۖ رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًا
rows.translation: So it was that We let them come upon them, that they might know that Allah’s promise is true, and that there is no doubt in the Hour. As they disputed among themselves about their matter, they said, ‘Build a building over them. Their Lord knows them best.’ Those who had the say in their matter said, ‘We will set up a place of worship over them.’
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika a`tharnā `alayhim liya`lamū anna wa`dallāhi ḥaqqun wa-annas sā`ata lā rayba fīhā idh yatanāza`ūna baynahum amrahum ۖ faqālub-nū `alayhim bunyānā ۖ rabbuhum a`lamu bihim ۚ qālal ladhīna ghalabū `alā amrihim lanattakhidhanna `alayhim masjidā

rows.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَـٰثَةٌ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًۢا بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ ۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَآءً ظَـٰهِرًا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: They will say, ‘[They are] three; their dog is the fourth of them,’ and say, ‘[They are] five, their dog is the sixth of them,’ taking a shot at the invisible. They will say, ‘[They are] seven, their dog is the eighth of them.’ Say, ‘My Lord knows best their number, and none knows them except a few.’ So do not dispute concerning them, except for a seeming dispute, and do not question about them any of them.
rows.transliteration: sayaqūlūna thalāthatun rābi`uhum kalbuhum wayaqūlūna khamsatun sādisuhum kalbuhum rajman bil ghayb ۖ wayaqūlūna sab`atun wathāminuhum kalbuhum ۚ qul rabbī a`lamu bi`iddatihim mā ya`lamuhum illā qalīl ۗ falā tumāri fīhim illā mirā-an ẓāhiran walā tastafti fīhim minhum aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىْءٍ إِنِّى فَاعِلٌ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا
rows.translation: Do not say about anything, ‘I will indeed do it tomorrow,’
rows.transliteration: walā taqūlanna lishay-in innī fā`ilun dhālika ghadā

rows.arabic: إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّى لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَـٰذَا رَشَدًا
rows.translation: without [adding], ‘God willing.’ And when you forget, remember your Lord, and say, ‘Maybe my Lord will guide me to [something] more akin to rectitude than this.’
rows.transliteration: illā an yashā-allāh ۚ wadhkur rabbaka idhā nasīta waqul `asā an yahdiyani rabbī li-aqraba min hādhā rashadā

rows.arabic: وَلَبِثُوا۟ فِى كَهْفِهِمْ ثَلَـٰثَ مِا۟ئَةٍ سِنِينَ وَٱزْدَادُوا۟ تِسْعًا
rows.translation: They remained in the Cave for three hundred years, and added nine more [to that number].
rows.transliteration: walabithū fī kahfihim thalātha mī-atin sinīna wazdādū tis`ā

rows.arabic: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثُوا۟ ۖ لَهُۥ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ أَبْصِرْ بِهِۦ وَأَسْمِعْ ۚ مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا يُشْرِكُ فِى حُكْمِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: Say, ‘Allah knows best how long they remained. To Him belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. How well does He see! How well does He hear! They have no guardian besides Him, and none shares with Him in His judgement.’
rows.transliteration: qulillāhu a`lamu bimā labithū ۖ lahu ghaybus samāwāti wal-arḍ ۖ abṣir bihi wa-asmi` ۚ mā lahum min dūnihi min waliyyin walā yushriku fī ḥukmihi aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِن كِتَابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
rows.translation: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. Nothing can change His words, and you will never find any refuge besides Him.
rows.transliteration: watlu mā ūḥiya ilayka min kitābi rabbik ۖ lā mubaddila likalimātihi walan tajida min dūnihi multaḥadā

rows.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ نَفْسَكَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَدَوٰةِ وَٱلْعَشِىِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَعْدُ عَيْنَاكَ عَنْهُمْ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا تُطِعْ مَنْ أَغْفَلْنَا قَلْبَهُۥ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ وَكَانَ أَمْرُهُۥ فُرُطًا
rows.translation: Content yourself with the company of those who supplicate their Lord morning and evening, desiring His Face, and do not lose sight of them, desiring the glitter of the life of this world. And do not obey him whose heart We have made oblivious to Our remembrance, and who follows his own desires, and whose conduct is [mere] profligacy.
rows.transliteration: waṣbir nafsaka ma`al ladhīna yad`ūna rabbahum bil ghadāti wal `ashiyyi yurīdūna wajhah ۖ walā ta`du `aynāka `anhum turīdu zīnatal ḥayātid dunyā ۖ walā tuṭi` man aghfalnā qalbahu `an dhikrinā wattaba`a hawāhu wakāna amruhu furuṭā

rows.arabic: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيُؤْمِن وَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيَكْفُرْ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمْ سُرَادِقُهَا ۚ وَإِن يَسْتَغِيثُوا۟ يُغَاثُوا۟ بِمَآءٍ كَٱلْمُهْلِ يَشْوِى ٱلْوُجُوهَ ۚ بِئْسَ ٱلشَّرَابُ وَسَآءَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
rows.translation: And say, ‘[This is] the truth from your Lord: let anyone who wishes believe it, and let anyone who wishes disbelieve it.’ Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose curtains will surround them [on all sides]. If they cry out for help, they will be helped with a water like molten copper, which will scald their faces. What an evil drink, and how ill a resting place!
rows.transliteration: waqulil ḥaqqu min rabbikum ۖ faman shā-a falyu-min wa man shā-a falyakfur ۚ innā a`tadnā liẓẓālimīna nāran aḥāṭa bihim surādiquhā ۚ wa in yastaghīthū yughāthū bimā-in kal muhli yashwil wujūh ۚ bi-sash sharābu wasā-at murtafaqā

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ عَمَلًا
rows.translation: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds—indeed We do not waste the reward of those who are good in deeds.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti innā lā nuḍī`u ajra man aḥsana `amalā

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَيَلْبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضْرًا مِّن سُندُسٍ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلثَّوَابُ وَحَسُنَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
rows.translation: For such there will be the gardens of Eden with streams running in them. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and wear green garments of silk and brocade, reclining therein on couches. How excellent a reward, and how good a resting place!
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika lahum jannātu `adnin tajrī min taḥtihimul-anhāru yuḥallawna fīhā min asāwira min dhahabin wayalbasūna thiyāban khuḍran min sundusin wa istabraqin muttaki-īna fīhā `alal-arā-ik ۚ ni`math thawābu waḥasunat murtafaqā

rows.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًا رَّجُلَيْنِ جَعَلْنَا لِأَحَدِهِمَا جَنَّتَيْنِ مِنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍ وَحَفَفْنَـٰهُمَا بِنَخْلٍ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمَا زَرْعًا
rows.translation: Draw for them the parable of two men for each of whom We had made two gardens of vines, and We had surrounded them with date palms, and placed crops between them.
rows.transliteration: waḍrib lahum mathalan rajulayni ja`alnā li-aḥadihimā jannatayni min a`nābin waḥafafnāhumā binakhlin waja`alnā baynahumā zar`ā

rows.arabic: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًٔا ۚ وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَـٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًا
rows.translation: Both gardens yielded their produce without stinting anything of it. And We had set a stream gushing through them.
rows.transliteration: kiltal jannatayni ātat ukulahā walam taẓlim minhu shay-ā ۚ wafajjarnā khilālahumā naharā

rows.arabic: وَكَانَ لَهُۥ ثَمَرٌ فَقَالَ لِصَـٰحِبِهِۦ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَنَا۠ أَكْثَرُ مِنكَ مَالًا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًا
rows.translation: He had abundant fruits, so he said to his companion, as he conversed with him: ‘I have more wealth than you, and am stronger with respect to numbers.’
rows.transliteration: wakāna lahu thamarun faqāla liṣāḥibihi wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu ana aktharu minka mālan wa-a`azzu nafarā

rows.arabic: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًا
rows.translation: He entered his garden while he wronged himself. He said, ‘I do not think that this will ever perish,
rows.transliteration: wadakhala jannatahu wahuwa ẓālimul linafsihi qāla mā aẓunnu an tabīda hādhihi abadā

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَظُنُّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ قَآئِمَةً وَلَئِن رُّدِدتُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيْرًا مِّنْهَا مُنقَلَبًا
rows.translation: and I do not think that the Hour will ever set in. And even if I am returned to my Lord I will surely find a resort better than this.’
rows.transliteration: wa mā aẓunnus sā`ata qā-imatan wala-in rudidtu ilā rabbī la-ajidanna khayran minhā munqalabā

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ صَاحِبُهُۥ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَكَفَرْتَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰكَ رَجُلًا
rows.translation: His companion said to him, as he conversed with him: ‘Do you disbelieve in Him who created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then fashioned you as a man?
rows.transliteration: qāla lahu ṣāḥibuhu wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu akafarta bil ladhī khalaqaka min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma sawwāka rajulā

rows.arabic: لَّـٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: But I [say], ‘‘He is Allah, my Lord,’’ and I do not ascribe any partner to my Lord.
rows.transliteration: lākinna huwallāhu rabbī walā ushriku birabbī aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ دَخَلْتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلْتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا
rows.translation: Why did you not say, when you entered your garden, ‘‘[This is] as Allah has willed! There is no power except by Allah!’’ If you see that I have lesser wealth than you and children,
rows.transliteration: walawlā idh dakhalta jannataka qulta mā shā-allāhu lā quwwata illā billāh ۚ in tarani ana aqalla minka mālan wawaladā

rows.arabic: فَعَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يُؤْتِيَنِ خَيْرًا مِّن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهَا حُسْبَانًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتُصْبِحَ صَعِيدًا زَلَقًا
rows.translation: maybe my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden, and He will unleash upon it bolts from the sky, so that it becomes a bare plain.
rows.transliteration: fa`asā rabbī an yu-tiyani khayran min jannatika wayursila `alayhā ḥusbānan minas samā-i fatuṣbiḥa ṣa`īdan zalaqā

rows.arabic: أَوْ يُصْبِحَ مَآؤُهَا غَوْرًا فَلَن تَسْتَطِيعَ لَهُۥ طَلَبًا
rows.translation: Or its water will sink down, so that you will never be able to obtain it.’
rows.transliteration: aw yuṣbiḥa mā-uhā ghawran falan tastaṭī`a lahu ṭalabā

rows.arabic: وَأُحِيطَ بِثَمَرِهِۦ فَأَصْبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيْهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُشْرِكْ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: And ruin closed in on his produce, and he began to wring his hands for what he had spent on it, as it lay fallen on its trellises. He was saying, ‘I wish I had not ascribed any partner to my Lord.’
rows.transliteration: wa-uḥīṭa bithamarihi fa-aṣbaḥa yuqallibu kaffayhi `alā mā anfaqa fīhā wahiya khāwiyatun `alā `urūshihā wayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ushrik birabbī aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُۥ فِئَةٌ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مُنتَصِرًا
rows.translation: He had no party to help him, besides Allah, nor could he help himself.
rows.transliteration: walam takun lahu fi-atun yanṣurūnahu min dūnillāhi wa mā kāna muntaṣirā

rows.arabic: هُنَالِكَ ٱلْوَلَـٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيْرٌ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ عُقْبًا
rows.translation: There, all authority belongs to Allah, the Real. He is best in rewarding, and best in requiting.
rows.transliteration: hunālikal walāyatu lillāhil ḥaqq ۚ huwa khayrun thawāban wakhayrun `uqbā

rows.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَصْبَحَ هَشِيمًا تَذْرُوهُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحُ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مُّقْتَدِرًا
rows.translation: Draw for them the parable of the life of this world: [It is] like the water We send down from the sky. Then the earth’s vegetation mingles with it. Then it becomes chaff, scattered by the wind. And Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: waḍrib lahum mathalal-ḥayātid dunyā kamā-in anzalnāhu minas samā-i fakhtalaṭa bihi nabātul-arḍi fa-aṣbaḥa hashīman tadhrūhur riyāḥ ۗ wakānallāhu `alā kulli shay-in muqtadirā

rows.arabic: ٱلْمَالُ وَٱلْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ أَمَلًا
rows.translation: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of the world, but lasting righteous deeds are better with your Lord in reward and better in hope.
rows.transliteration: al-mālu wal banūna zīnatul ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wal bāqiyātuṣ ṣāliḥātu khayrun `inda rabbika thawāban wakhayrun amalā

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةً وَحَشَرْنَـٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: The day We shall set the mountains moving and you will see the earth in full view, We shall muster them, and We will not leave out anyone of them.
rows.transliteration: wayawma nusayyirul jibāla wataral-arḍa bārizatan waḥasharnāhum falam nughādir minhum aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَعُرِضُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّا لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۭ ۚ بَلْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَلَّن نَّجْعَلَ لَكُم مَّوْعِدًا
rows.translation: They will be presented before your Lord in ranks: ‘Certainly you have come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you maintained that We shall not appoint a tryst for you.’
rows.transliteration: wa`uriḍū `alā rabbika ṣaffal laqad ji-tumūnā kamā khalaqnākum awwala marrah ۚ bal za`amtum allan naj`ala lakum maw`idā

rows.arabic: وَوُضِعَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ فَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُشْفِقِينَ مِمَّا فِيهِ وَيَقُولُونَ يَـٰوَيْلَتَنَا مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةً وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحْصَىٰهَا ۚ وَوَجَدُوا۟ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ حَاضِرًا ۗ وَلَا يَظْلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًا
rows.translation: The Book will be set up. Then you will see the guilty apprehensive of what is in it. They will say, ‘Woe to us! What a book is this! It omits nothing, big or small, without enumerating it.’ They will find present whatever they had done, and your Lord does not wrong anyone.
rows.transliteration: wawuḍi`al kitābu fataral mujrimīna mushfiqīna mimmā fīhi wayaqūlūna yāwaylatanā māli hādhal kitābi lā yughādiru ṣaghīratan walā kabīratan illā aḥṣāhā ۚ wawajadū mā `amilū ḥāḍirā ۗ walā yaẓlimu rabbuka aḥadā

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذُونَهُۥ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِى وَهُمْ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۢ ۚ بِئْسَ لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بَدَلًا
rows.translation: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis. He was one of the jinn, so he transgressed against his Lord’s command. Will you then take him and his offspring for guardians in My stead, though they are your enemies? How evil a substitute for the wrongdoers!
rows.transliteration: wa idh qulnā lil-malā-ikatis-judū li-ādama fasajadū illā iblīsa kāna minal jinni fafasaqa `an amri rabbih ۗ afatattakhidhūnahu wadhurriyyatahu awliyā-a min dūnī wahum lakum `aduww ۚ bi-sa liẓẓālimīna badalā

rows.arabic: مَّآ أَشْهَدتُّهُمْ خَلْقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا خَلْقَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ ٱلْمُضِلِّينَ عَضُدًا
rows.translation: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor to their own creation, nor do I take those who mislead others as assistants.
rows.transliteration: mā ash-hadtuhum khalqas samāwāti wal-arḍi walā khalqa anfusihim wa mā kuntu muttakhidhal muḍillīna `aḍudā

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ نَادُوا۟ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّوْبِقًا
rows.translation: The day He will say [to the polytheists], ‘Call those whom you maintained to be My partners,’ they will call them, but they will not respond to them, for We shall set an abyss between them.
rows.transliteration: wayawma yaqūlu nādū shurakā-iyal ladhīna za`amtum fada`awhum falam yastajībū lahum waja`alnā baynahum mawbiqā

rows.arabic: وَرَءَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ ٱلنَّارَ فَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مُّوَاقِعُوهَا وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ عَنْهَا مَصْرِفًا
rows.translation: The guilty will sight the Fire and know that they are about to fall in it, for they will find no way to escape it.
rows.transliteration: wara al mujrimūnan nāra faẓannū annahum muwāqi`ūhā walam yajidū `anhā maṣrifā

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِلنَّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَكْثَرَ شَىْءٍ جَدَلًا
rows.translation: We have certainly interspersed this Quran with every kind of parable for the people. But man is the most disputatious of creatures.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ṣarrafnā fī hādhal qur-āni linnāsi min kulli mathal ۚ wakānal-insānu akthara shay-in jadalā

rows.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَ ٱلنَّاسَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ قُبُلًا
rows.translation: Nothing has kept these people from believing and pleading to their Lord for forgiveness when guidance came to them, except [their demand] that the precedent of the ancients come to pass for them, or that the punishment come to them, face to face.
rows.transliteration: wa mā mana`an nāsa an yu-minū idh jā-ahumul hudā wayastaghfirū rabbahum illā an ta-tiyahum sunnatul-awwalīna aw ya-tiyahumul `adhābu qubulā

rows.arabic: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۚ وَيُجَـٰدِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا۟ بِهِ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَمَآ أُنذِرُوا۟ هُزُوًا
rows.translation: We do not send the apostles except as bearers of good news and as warners, but those who are faithless dispute fallaciously to refute thereby the truth, having taken My signs and what they are warned of in derision.
rows.transliteration: wa mā nursilul mursalīna illā mubashhirīna wa mundhirīn ۚ wayujādilul ladhīna kafarū bil bāṭili liyud-ḥiḍū bihil ḥaqq ۖ wattakhadhū āyātī wa mā undhirū huzuwā

rows.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهَا وَنَسِىَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ ۚ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًا ۖ وَإِن تَدْعُهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهْتَدُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًا
rows.translation: Who is a greater wrongdoer than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, whereat he disregards them and forgets what his hands have sent ahead? Indeed We have cast veils on their hearts lest they should understand it, and a deafness into their ears; and if you invite them to guidance they will never [let themselves] be guided.
rows.transliteration: wa man aẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-āyāti rabbihi fa-a`raḍa `anhā wanasiya mā qaddamat yadāh ۚ innā ja`alnā `alā qulūbihim akinnatan an yafqahūhu wafī ādhānihim waqrā ۖ wa in tad`uhum ilal-hudā falan yahtadū idhan abadā

rows.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ذُو ٱلرَّحْمَةِ ۖ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ بَل لَّهُم مَّوْعِدٌ لَّن يَجِدُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوْئِلًا
rows.translation: Your Lord is the All-forgiving dispenser of mercy. Were He to take them to task because of what they have committed, He would have surely hastened their punishment. But they have a tryst, [when] they will not find a refuge besides Him.
rows.transliteration: warabbukal ghafūru dhur raḥmah ۖ law yu-ākhidhuhum bimā kasabū la`ajjala lahumul `adhāb ۚ bal lahum maw`idul lan yajidū min dūnihi maw-ilā

rows.arabic: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ وَجَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِكِهِم مَّوْعِدًا
rows.translation: Those are the towns that We destroyed when they were wrongdoers, and We appointed a tryst for their destruction.
rows.transliteration: watilkal qurā ahlaknāhum lammā ẓalamū waja`alnā limahlikihim maw`idā

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِفَتَىٰهُ لَآ أَبْرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبْلُغَ مَجْمَعَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ أَوْ أَمْضِىَ حُقُبًا
rows.translation: When Moses said to his lad, ‘I will go on [journeying] until I have reached the confluence of the two seas, or have spent a long time [travelling].’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla mūsā lifatāhu lā abraḥu ḥattā ablugha majma`al baḥrayni aw amḍiya ḥuqubā

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ سَرَبًا
rows.translation: So when they reached the confluence between them, they forgot their fish, which found its way into the sea, sneaking away.
rows.transliteration: falammā balaghā majma`a baynihimā nasiyā ḥūtahumā fattakhadha sabīlahu fil baḥri sarabā

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَىٰهُ ءَاتِنَا غَدَآءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَـٰذَا نَصَبًا
rows.translation: So when they had passed on, he said to his lad, ‘Bring us our meal. We have certainly encountered much fatigue on this journey of ours.’
rows.transliteration: falammā jāwazā qāla lifatāhu ātinā ghadā-anā laqad laqīnā min safarinā hādhā naṣabā

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّى نَسِيتُ ٱلْحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُۥ ۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ عَجَبًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘Did you see?! When we took shelter at the rock, indeed I forgot about the fish—and none but Satan made me forget to mention it!—and it made its way into the sea in an amazing manner!’
rows.transliteration: qāla ara ayta idh awaynā ilaṣ ṣakhrati fa-innī nasītul ḥūta wa mā ansānīhu illash shayṭānu an adhkurah ۚ wattakhadha sabīlahu fil baḥri `ajabā

rows.arabic: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَٱرْتَدَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘That is what we were after!’ So they returned, retracing their footsteps.
rows.transliteration: qāla dhālika mā kunnā nabgh ۚ fartaddā `alā āthārihimā qaṣaṣā

rows.arabic: فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًا
rows.translation: [There] they found one of Our servants whom We had granted a mercy from Ourselves, and taught him a knowledge from Our own.
rows.transliteration: fawajadā `abdan min `ibādinā ātaynāhu raḥmatan min `indinā wa`allamnāhu min ladunnā `il-mā

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًا
rows.translation: Moses said to him, ‘May I follow you for the purpose that you teach me some of the probity you have been taught?’
rows.transliteration: qāla lahu mūsā hal attabi`uka `alā an tu`allimani mimmā `ullimta rushdā

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘Indeed you cannot have patience with me!
rows.transliteration: qāla innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

rows.arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًا
rows.translation: And how can you have patience about something you do not comprehend?’
rows.transliteration: wakayfa taṣbiru `alā mā lam tuḥiṭ bihi khubrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ صَابِرًا وَلَآ أَعْصِى لَكَ أَمْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘You will find me, God willing, to be patient, and I will not disobey you in any matter.’
rows.transliteration: qāla satajidunī in shā-allāhu ṣābiran walā a`ṣī laka amrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘If you follow me, do not question me concerning anything until I myself first mention it for you.’
rows.transliteration: qāla fa-init-taba`tanī falā tas-alnī `an shay-in ḥattā uḥditha laka minhu dhikrā

rows.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِى ٱلسَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا إِمْرًا
rows.translation: So they went on and when they boarded the boat, he made a hole in it. He said, ‘Did you make a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done a monstrous thing!’
rows.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā rakibā fis safīnati kharaqahā ۖ qāla akharaqtahā litughriqa ahlahā laqad ji-ta shay-an imrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘Did I not say that you cannot have patience with me?’
rows.transliteration: qāla alam aqul innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘Do not take me to task for my forgetting, and do not be hard upon me.’
rows.transliteration: qāla lā tu-ākhidhnī bimā nasītu walā turhiqnī min amrī `usrā

rows.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَـٰمًا فَقَتَلَهُۥ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا زَكِيَّةًۢ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا نُّكْرًا
rows.translation: So they went on until they came upon a boy, whereat he slew him. He said, ‘Did you slay an innocent soul, without [his having slain] anyone? You have certainly done a dire thing!’
rows.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā laqiyā ghulāman faqatalahu qāla aqatalta nafsan zakiyyatan bighayri nafsin laqad ji-ta shay-an nukrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘Did I not tell you that you cannot have patience with me?’
rows.transliteration: qāla alam aqul laka innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَىْءٍۭ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَـٰحِبْنِى ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّى عُذْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘If I question you about anything after this, do not keep me in your company. You already have enough excuse on my part.’
rows.transliteration: qāla in sa-altuka `an shay-in ba`dahā falā tuṣāḥibnī ۖ qad balaghta min ladunnī `udhrā

rows.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَيَآ أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ ٱسْتَطْعَمَآ أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا۟ أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا
rows.translation: So they went on until they came to the people of a town. They asked its people for food, but they refused to extend them any hospitality. There they found a wall which was about to collapse, so he erected it. He said, ‘Had you wished, you could have taken a wage for it.’
rows.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā atayā ahla qaryatinis-taṭ`amā ahlahā fa-abaw an yuḍayyifūhumā fawajadā fīhā jidāran yurīdu an yanqaḍḍa fa-aqāmah ۖ qāla law shi-ta lattakhadhta `alayhi ajrā

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘This is where you and I shall part. I will inform you about the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.
rows.transliteration: qāla hādhā firāqu baynī wabaynik ۚ sa-unabbi-uka bita-wīli mā lam tastaṭi` `alayhi ṣabrā

rows.arabic: أَمَّا ٱلسَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَـٰكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٌ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًا
rows.translation: As for the boat, it belonged to some poor people who work on the sea. I wanted to make it defective, for behind them was a king seizing every ship usurpingly.
rows.transliteration: ammas safīnatu fakānat limasākīna ya`malūna fil baḥri fa-aradtu an a`ībahā wakāna warā-ahum malikun ya-khudhu kulla safīnatin ghaṣbā

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْغُلَـٰمُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَآ أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَـٰنًا وَكُفْرًا
rows.translation: As for the boy, his parents were faithful [persons], and We feared he would overwhelm them with rebellion and unfaith.
rows.transliteration: wa-ammal ghulāmu fakāna abawāhu mu-minayni fakhashīnā an yurhiqahumā ṭughyānan wakufrā

rows.arabic: فَأَرَدْنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهُ زَكَوٰةً وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًا
rows.translation: So We desired that their Lord should give them in exchange one better than him in respect of purity and closer in mercy.
rows.transliteration: fa-aradnā an yubdilahumā rabbuhumā khayran minhu zakātan wa-aqraba ruḥmā

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَـٰمَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُۥ كَنزٌ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَـٰلِحًا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَآ أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُۥ عَنْ أَمْرِى ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
rows.translation: As for the wall, it belonged to two boy orphans in the city. Under it there was a treasure belonging to them. Their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord desired that they should come of age and take out their treasure—as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do that out of my own accord. This is the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.’
rows.transliteration: wa-ammal jidāru fakāna lighulāmayni yatīmayni fil madīnati wakāna taḥtahu kanzul lahumā wakāna abūhumā ṣāliḥan fa-arāda rabbuka an yablughā ashuddahumā wayastakhrijā kanzahumā raḥmatan min rabbik ۚ wa mā fa`altuhu `an amrī ۚ dhālika ta-wīlu mā lam tasṭi` `alayhi ṣabrā

rows.arabic: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَن ذِى ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا
rows.translation: They question you concerning Dhul Qarnayn. Say, ‘I will relate to you an account of him.’
rows.transliteration: wayas-alūnaka `an dhil qarnayn ۖ qul sa-atlū `alaykum minhu dhikrā

rows.arabic: إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ سَبَبًا
rows.translation: Indeed We had granted him power in the land and given him the means to all things.
rows.transliteration: innā makkannā lahu fil-arḍi wa-ātaynāhu min kulli shay-in sababā

rows.arabic: فَأَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
rows.translation: So he directed a means.
rows.transliteration: fa-atba`a sababā

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِى عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًا ۗ قُلْنَا يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًا
rows.translation: When he reached the place where the sun sets, he found it setting over a warm sea, and by it he found a people. We said, ‘O Dhul Qarnayn! You will either punish them, or treat them with kindness.’
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha maghribash shamsi wajadahā taghrubu fī `aynin ḥami-atin wawajada `indahā qawmā ۗ qulnā yādhal qarnayni immā an tu`adhhiba wa immā an tattakhidha fīhim ḥusnā

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُۥ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًا نُّكْرًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘As for him who is a wrongdoer, we will punish him. Then he shall be returned to his Lord and He will punish him with a dire punishment.
rows.transliteration: qāla ammā man ẓalama fasawfa nu`adhhibuhu thumma yuraddu ilā rabbihi fayu`adhhibuhu `adhāban nukrā

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَلَهُۥ جَزَآءً ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًا
rows.translation: But as for him who has faith and acts righteously, he shall have the best reward, and we will assign him easy tasks under our command.’
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā man āmana wa`amila ṣāliḥan falahu jazā-anil-ḥusnā ۖ wasanaqūlu lahu min amrinā yusrā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
rows.translation: Thereafter he directed another means.
rows.transliteration: thumma atba`a sababā

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًا
rows.translation: When he reached the place where the sun rises, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not provided any shield against it.
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha maṭli`ash shamsi wajadahā taṭlu`u `alā qawmin lam naj`al lahum min dūnihā sitrā

rows.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًا
rows.translation: So it was, and We were fully aware of whatever [means] he possessed.
rows.transliteration: kadhālika waqad aḥaṭnā bimā ladayhi khubrā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
rows.translation: Thereafter he directed another means.
rows.transliteration: thumma atba`a sababā

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًا
rows.translation: When he reached [the place] between the two barriers, he found between them a people who could hardly understand a word [of his language].
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha baynas saddayni wajada min dūnihimā qawmal lā yakādūna yafqahūna qawlā

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّا
rows.translation: They said, ‘O Dhul Qarnayn! Indeed Gog and Magog are causing disaster in this land. Shall we pay you a tribute on condition that you build a barrier between them and us?’
rows.transliteration: qālū yādhal qarnayni inna ya-jūja wa ma-jūja mufsidūna fil-arḍi fahal naj`alu laka kharjan `alā an taj`ala baynanā wabaynahum saddā

rows.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘What my Lord has furnished me is better. Yet help me with some strength, and I will make a bulwark between you and them.
rows.transliteration: qāla mā makkannī fīhi rabbī khayrun fa-a`īnūnī biquwwatin aj`al baynakum wabaynahum radmā

rows.arabic: ءَاتُونِى زُبَرَ ٱلْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُوا۟ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارًا قَالَ ءَاتُونِىٓ أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًا
rows.translation: Bring me pieces of iron!’ When he had levelled up between the flanks, he said, ‘Blow!’ When he had turned it into fire, he said, ‘Bring me molten copper to pour over it.’
rows.transliteration: ātūnī zubaral ḥadīd ۖ ḥattā idhā sāwā baynaṣ ṣadafayni qālan-fukhū ۖ ḥattā idhā ja`alahu nāran qāla ātūnī ufrigh `alayhi qiṭrā

rows.arabic: فَمَا ٱسْطَـٰعُوٓا۟ أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ لَهُۥ نَقْبًا
rows.translation: So they could neither scale it, nor could they make a hole in it.
rows.transliteration: famas-ṭā`ū an yaẓharūhu wa mas-taṭā`ū lahu naqbā

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا رَحْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى حَقًّا
rows.translation: He said, ‘This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord is fulfilled, He will level it; and my Lord’s promise is true.’
rows.transliteration: qāla hādhā raḥmatun min rabbī ۖ fa-idhā jā-a wa`du rabbī ja`alahu dakkā-a ۖ wakāna wa`du rabbī ḥaqqā

rows.arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَمُوجُ فِى بَعْضٍ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ جَمْعًا
rows.translation: That day We shall let them surge over one another, the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall gather them all,
rows.transliteration: wataraknā ba`ḍahum yawma-idhiy yamūju fī ba`ḍ ۖ wanufikha fiṣ ṣūri fajama`nāhum jam`ā

rows.arabic: وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَرْضًا
rows.translation: and on that day We shall bring hell into view visibly for the faithless.
rows.transliteration: wa`araḍnā jahannama yawma-idhin lilkāfirīna `arḍā

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِى غِطَآءٍ عَن ذِكْرِى وَكَانُوا۟ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا
rows.translation: —Those whose eyes were blind to My remembrance and who could not hear.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna kānat a`yunuhum fī ghiṭā-in `an dhikrī wakānū lā yastaṭī`ūna sam`ā

rows.arabic: أَفَحَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن يَتَّخِذُوا۟ عِبَادِى مِن دُونِىٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ نُزُلًا
rows.translation: Do the faithless suppose that they have taken My servants for guardians in My stead? Indeed, We have prepared hell for the hospitality of the faithless.
rows.transliteration: afaḥasibal ladhīna kafarū an yattakhidhū `ibādī min dūnī awliyā-a ۚ innā a`tadnā jahannama lilkāfirīna nuzulā

rows.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ نُنَبِّئُكُم بِٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ أَعْمَـٰلًا
rows.translation: Say, ‘Shall we inform you who are the biggest losers in their works?
rows.transliteration: qul hal nunabbi-ukum bil-akhsarīna a`mālā

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا
rows.translation: Those whose efforts are misguided in the life of the world, while they suppose they are doing good.’
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ḍalla sa`yuhum fil ḥayātid dunyā wahum yaḥsabūna annahum yuḥsinūna ṣun`ā

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَزْنًا
rows.translation: They are the ones who deny the signs of their Lord and encounter with Him. So their works have failed. On the Day of Resurrection We will not give them any weight.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyāti rabbihim waliqā-ihi faḥabiṭat a`māluhum falā nuqīmu lahum yawmal qiyāmati waznā

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَرُسُلِى هُزُوًا
rows.translation: That is their requital—hell—because of their unfaith and for deriding My signs and apostles.
rows.transliteration: dhālika jazā-uhum jahannamu bimā kafarū wattakhadhū āyātī warusulī huzuwā

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
rows.translation: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, they shall have the gardens of Firdaws for abode,
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti kānat lahum jannātul firdawsi nuzulā

rows.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًا
rows.translation: to remain in them [forever]; they will not seek to leave it for another place.
rows.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā lā yabghūna `anhā ḥiwalā

rows.arabic: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ ٱلْبَحْرُ مِدَادًا لِّكَلِمَـٰتِ رَبِّى لَنَفِدَ ٱلْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَـٰتُ رَبِّى وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِۦ مَدَدًا
rows.translation: Say, ‘If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the words of my Lord are finished, though We replenish it with another like it.’
rows.transliteration: qul law kānal baḥru midādal likalimāti rabbī lanafidal baḥru qabla an tanfada kalimātu rabbī walaw ji-nā bimithlihi madadā

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًا صَـٰلِحًا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَحَدًۢا
rows.translation: Say, ‘I am just a human being like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So whoever expects to encounter his Lord—let him act righteously, and not associate anyone with the worship of his Lord.’
rows.transliteration: qul innamā ana basharun mithlukum yūḥā ilayya annamā ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥid ۖ faman kāna yarjū liqā-a rabbihi falya`mal `amalan ṣāliḥan walā yushrik bi`ibādati rabbihi aḥadā
